response.answer_text: There are 2 possibilities. If your immune system reacts vigorously, the bacteria (mycobacterium leprae) will stick to your nerves, and most probably you will not experience any deadly symptoms. However, if your immune system responds weakly, the bacteria will run rampant through your body. You will lose your sensation of pressure and pain. Also the area between your nostrils might collapse. Why is the first symptom deadly? Sometimes pain might be the only sign that something is wrong. If you don’t feel pain, you won’t know that something is wrong, you won’t seek medical help, and whatever is wrong is more likely to kill you. But leprosy does not rot flesh. It does not cause your hands & legs to fall of. If you die of leprosy, you either die due to loss of sensation, or you die due to nostril collapse.

Leprosy is mainly affect the skin and the nerve but it can affect all the orgens of the body except nail Depending upon your immunity leprosy have different range of severity and symptoms Good cell mediated immunity you may not show any symptoms or may be one hypopigmented patch no nerve involvement Poor cell mediated immunity multiple hypopigmented patch over body and nerve is involved as the leprosy progress you may get paralysis of nerve initially sensory than motor loss devloped Deformity in hand foot and face and eye lids But due to awareness and free treatment in India incidence of leprosy is < 1/100000 Leprosy is curable diseases If any one have any symptoms like hyper or hypopigmented patch with or without loss of hot and cold sensetion over it or any neuronal involvement contact nearest primary health centre get checked for leprosy get the treatment done according to national leprosy eradication program according to your diseases Treatment duration is 6 month to 12 month
